intro: Straussia hillebrandii var. molokaiensis, commonly known as the Molokaʻi starburst, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble a starburst pattern. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by native insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
